newsitem.title: JAPAN: Fujitsu to stop SRAM chip production by end-March.
newsitem.headline: Fujitsu to stop SRAM chip production by end-March.

text.p: Fujitsu Ltd said on Monday it would withdraw from production of static random-access memories (SRAMs) and two other types of chips by the end of next March in order to focus on production of dynamic random-access memory (DRAM) chips and flash memories.

By March 31, Fujitsu will close one of the lines at its plant in Iwate, northern Japan, which produces SRAM chips as well as erasable programmable read-only memories (EPROM) and mask ROM chips, a company spokeswoman said.
It does not make these types of semiconductors at its other plants, she said.
Fujitsu formed a plan at the beginning of last year to scrap the line by the end of March 1997, the spokeswoman said.
